instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 Green Light no Power
threads.message:
3115 board with no liquid damage, only thing that looks funny is a tad bit of corrosion on a BKLT capacitor (C9712)

Pulsing PPVRTC, pulsing 5v_s5 and 3v3_s5, no PP5v_s3 or 3v3_s3.
CPUVcore is at 0.

PM_SLP_S4_L pulses around 20 mV so I don't think it's turning on enough for the SMC to do much.

MoBo is power cycling right? Probably a short on PP3v3_S5? Is this a rabbit hole board with no clear end?

threads.title: 820-3115 Green Light no Power
threads.message: Found a short on PP5v_s3, inject 5v see what happens?

threads.title: 820-3115 Green Light no Power
threads.message: You did check that without power and waited long enough for it to discharge? What is resistance to GND on 5V_S3?

threads.title: 820-3115 Green Light no Power
threads.message:
GND to 5V_S3 is .1 ohm
Yes, without power, checked again today without having powered on.

threads.title: 820-3115 Green Light no Power
threads.message: Inject voltage, the short is low enough that something should heat up. Start low and monitor current.
